intro: Ononis aragonensis var. gomarica, commonly known as the Gomara sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. This species is often found in coastal dunes and dry, disturbed habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
